entry.title: Apple's stock cuts losses after CEO emails on China business
entry.summary: Apple says the region it calls "Greater China," which includes Hong Kong and Taiwan, is its second-largest market - producing more than a quarter of its sales and its biggest share of growth last quarter.

entry.title: Apple shares take a white-knuckle dive Monday, then bounce back after CEO emails pundit
entry.summary: Apple and other U.S. tech stocks were rocked Monday by continued worries over China's economy, which is Apple's second-largest market.

entry.title: Apple's China business strong in July and August: Cook to CNBC
entry.summary:
Apple's shares fell as much as 13 percent to a year-low of $92 in early trading on Monday, wiping out nearly $80 billion of its market value.

Apple's shares later recovered to trade at $101.16, down 4.3 percent.

entry.title: Apple's China business strong in July and August: Cook to CNBC
entry.summary: (Reuters) - Apple Inc's (AAPL.O) China business experienced "strong growth" in July and August, Chief Executive Tim Cook told CNBC on Monday.

entry.title: Apple Recalls Some iPhone 6 Plus Models Over Blurry Photos
entry.summary: Apple said it would replace the phone free of charge if the iSight camera takes blurry photos and falls into a particular serial number range.

entry.title: Apple recalls some iPhone 6 Plus models over blurry photos
entry.summary:
A woman holds up the iPhone 6 Plus at the Apple Store at Tokyo's Omotesando shopping district September 19, 2014.

Apple Inc (AAPL.O) is recalling a limited number iPhone 6 Plus phones due to faulty back cameras that take blurry photos.

The affected phones were mostly sold in a 4-month period between September 2014 and January 2015, Apple said on its website.

entry.title: Did Apple make Dr. Dre apologize for beating women?
entry.summary: Apple said, "We believe his sincerity, and after working with him for a year and a half, we have every reason to believe that he has changed."

entry.title: Tesla engineer joins Apple's growing team of automated car experts
entry.summary:
A LinkedIn profile for Jamie Carlson shows that he has left Tesla and moved to Apple.

At least six others with experience developing self-driving technology and systems have joined Apple, according to their LinkedIn profiles.

Sources have said that Apple is developing a car and studying self-driving technology, but it is unclear if the iPhone maker is designing a vehicle that could drive itself.

entry.title: China smartphone sales fall for first time: Gartner
entry.summary:
Still, Apple Inc's share of the worldwide smartphone sales market rose to 14.6 percent from 12.2 percent a year earlier.

Apple's big-screen iPhone 6 and 6 Plus, which shattered iPhone sales records when they were launched, are about 11 months old.

entry.title: Pharrell, One Direction among headliners at Apple Music fest
entry.summary:
LOS ANGELES (AP) - Pharrell Williams, One Direction and Florence + The Machine are going to appear at the Apple Music Festival next month.

Niall Horan of One Direction said the group is excited to return to London "to perform for our fans in the Roundhouse and around the world on Apple Music!"

entry.summary: Apple, which is best known for making iPhones and Mac computers, hasn't said what kind of testing it hoped to conduct at the GoMentum Station automotive testing facility, which used to be a naval station in the San Francisco Bay Area city of Concord.

entry.title: Hedge funds added Apple shares in second quarter, filings show
entry.summary: At the end of the first quarter Apple was one of the most popular stocks owned by hedge funds, according to Goldman Sachs research.

entry.title: Hedge funds added Apple shares in second quarter, filings show
entry.summary:
Still, during the first quarter of this year a number of hedge funds cut their stakes in Apple as its shares rallied, previous filings showed.

Apple remains the most valuable U.S. company, with a market capitalization $657 billion.

BOSTON (Reuters) - Top U.S. hedge funds added to their positions in Apple Inc (AAPL.O) during the second quarter, even as shares of the iPhone maker were flat during the period.

Bridgewater Associates LP was a seller, however, cutting its Apple stake by 201,500 shares to 531,497 shares, filings show.

The decline could have exposed the second-quarter hedge fund buyers to losses, though some might have exited Apple before it fell from a high of $132.07 on July 20.

Their analysis of 685 hedge funds with nearly $1 trillion in equity assets found 69 of the funds had Apple among their top 10 holdings.

Tiger Eye Capital LLC added 25,000 shares of Apple to bring its total stake to 356,502 shares, filings showed.

entry.title: Apple says hired 65 percent more women in past year
entry.summary: Apple said it had hired over 11,000 women globally in the past year-65 percent more than the previous year-to boost employee diversity.

entry.title: Apple more than doubles hiring of women and minorities
entry.summary:
Like other major tech companies, Apple has been under public pressure to increase the number of women and minorities in a workforce that is overwhelmingly male and white or Asian.

Apple Inc. said 35 percent of its new hires worldwide last year were women, while 24 percent of U.S. hires were black or Hispanic.

As a result, Apple's global workforce of 110,000 is now 31 percent women, up from 30 percent last year.

But Jackson said he wants Apple and other tech companies to go beyond the federal report and provide more "comprehensive" data on hiring as well as purchasing and contracting with companies owned by women and minorities.

entry.title: Apple more than doubles hiring of women and minorities
Apple said to delay streaming TV service to 2016 as negotiations stall
entry.summary:
Just as Apple once convinced music labels to sell songs for a lowly 99 cents, it wants to offer a package of popular channels for $40 a month, the people said.

Apple, which has been trying for more than a decade to remake video entertainment, is struggling to find the right mix of channels to appeal to cord-cutters for about $40, said the people, who couldn't say when or if the negotiations would be completed.

entry.title: Apple to delay live TV service to next year: Bloomberg
entry.summary:
Apple also lacked the computer network capacity to ensure a good viewing experience, Bloomberg said.

The company still plans to introduce a more powerful version of its Apple TV set-top box at the event, which will be held in San Francisco.

entry.title: Apple, Others Likely to Take Hit From Yuan Devaluation

entry.summary: Apple's iTunes Store helped revitalize the music industry a decade ago, but digital downloads have slumped in recent years amid a shift toward streaming.

entry.title: Apple Music attracts more than 11 million trial members

entry.title: Apple Music has more than 11 million members
entry.summary:
After that, individuals can pay $10 a month, while families of up to six people can pay $15 a month for unlimited access to Apple Music on their devices.

In addition to the streaming subscription plan, Apple Music also includes a free Internet radio station and a media platform for artists to upload songs and videos for fans.

entry.summary: Meanwhile Apple said its App Store saw the largest-ever number of customers in July, yielding $1.7 billion in transactions.

entry.title: Apple Music Has More Than 11 Million Listeners
entry.summary:
(Reuters) - Apple Inc s new music streaming service has attracted more than 11 million members during its free trial period, the company said Thursday.

Apple set a high water mark for App Store customers in China in July.

entry.title: Who are the stock market heavyweights?
entry.summary: At the end of 1985, the company's stock made up 6.4 percent of the S&P 500's total value, much bigger than Apple's current 3.6 percent.

entry.title: When heavyweights like Apple, Microsoft, and Exxon move, the market reacts
entry.summary:
NEW YORK - At $654 billion, Apple is the stock market's heavyweight.

"The combination of Apple's size and price moves, results in an enormous impact on indices," says Howard Silverblatt, a senior index analyst for S&P Dow Jones Indices.

Lately, Apple's influence has been a drag.

Since closing at a record $133 on February 23, Apple has slumped to $115.40, wiping $115 billion off the value of its stock.

Without Apple, the decline would have been a gain of 0.1 percent, according to S&P Dow Jones Indices, the company behind the S&P 500 index and the Dow Jones industrial average.

Either way, for every $1 change in Apple stock, the S&P 500 rises or falls 0.6526 points, says Silverblatt.

The impact of the technology giant is so big that S&P Dow Jones Indices has created a technology index that excludes Apple.

entry.title: Apple Watch will be sold at some Best Buy stores
entry.summary: U.S. retailer Best Buy Co. says it will sell the Apple Watch at 100 of its stores and on its website beginning Aug. 7, 2015.

entry.title: Apple Watch will be sold at some Best Buy stores
entry.summary:
Best Buy, which has more than 1,000 stores in the U.S., says it's the first national retailer to sell the watch outside of Apple Inc.'s stores.

Apple unveiled the watch in September and began taking orders in April.

entry.title: Locals Best Buy stores to sell Apple Watch
entry.summary: "We are excited to bring the Apple Watch to more consumers, especially with the holidays coming up."

entry.title: Apple Watch to be sold at Best Buy stores from August
entry.summary: The Wall Street Journal first reported that the Apple watch was coming to Best Buy.

entry.title: Apple Watch to be sold at Best Buy stores from August
entry.summary:
(Reuters) - The Apple Watch will be available at stores of Best Buy Co Inc (BBY.N), the largest U.S. consumer electronics chain, starting Aug. 7.

The Apple Watch and Apple Watch Sport models will be sold at more than 300 Best Buy stores in time for the holiday shopping season, a spokeswoman for Apple Inc (AAPL.O) said.

entry.title: Apple Watch to be sold at Best Buy stores in August
entry.summary:
Best Buy is the first retailer to sell the watch outside of the Apple retail store.

"The Apple Watch is an important addition to an emerging product category, and we know our customers want it," Jason Bonfig, senior category officer, said on the Best Buy website.

entry.title: Apple Watch to be sold at Best Buy from August
Apple Watch coming to Best Buy in August
entry.summary: Best Buy said it will carry the Apple Watch Sport and Apple Watch models, plus accessories.
